metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8564 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The _gnutls_ecc_ansi_x963_export function in gnutls_ecc.c in GnuTLS 3.xbefore 3.1.28, 3.2.x before 3.2.20, and 3.3.x before 3.3.10 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted(1) Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificate or (2) certificatesigning requests (CSR), related to generating key IDs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.3.8-3ubuntu2
guile-gnutls - 3.3.8-3ubuntu2
libgnutls-deb0-28 - 3.3.8-3ubuntu2
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.3.8-3ubuntu2
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.3.8-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-3ubuntu2').
